name: Authentic Nam Prik Ong Recipe
description: This easy nam prik ong recipe creates a tasty Northern Thai pork and tomato dipping sauce that goes great with vegetables and sticky rice.

recipeIngredient: 6  large dried chilies ((dry red spur chilies))
1 teaspoon salt (+ 2tsp for soaking large dried chilies (optional))

recipeInstructions.text: Start by halving the large dried chilies and soak them in room temperature water with 2 teaspoons of salt. Allow them to soften for about 30 minutes and drain them afterward. This extra step is to ease the pounding process.
recipeInstructions.name: Start by halving the large dried chilies and soak them in room temperature water with 2 teaspoons of salt. Allow them to soften for about 30 minutes and drain them afterward. This extra step is to ease the pounding process.

recipeInstructions.text: Use a granite mortar and pestle to pound the pre-soaked chilies, optional small dried chilies, shallots, garlic, and shrimp paste into a smooth, fine paste.
recipeInstructions.name: Use a granite mortar and pestle to pound the pre-soaked chilies, optional small dried chilies, shallots, garlic, and shrimp paste into a smooth, fine paste.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a large non-stick wok pan or skillet over medium heat. Add the freshly made paste and fry for approx 1 minute, until fragrant.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir in tamarind paste, fish sauce, salt, palm sugar, and tomatoes. Cook until palm sugar has completely dissolved, and the tomatoes are tender, about 10 minutes, stirring regularly.

recipeInstructions.text: Lastly, pour in water and let the red sauce simmer for 1 more minute, or until the sauce has the consistency of a tomato sauce/bolognese sauce for spaghetti. Serve hot and enjoy!
